data.title: Oji Holdings Corporation Revises Consolidated Earnings Guidance for the End of Second Quarter Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
Oji Holdings Corporation revised consolidated earnings guidance for the end of second quarter ended September 30, 2025. For the period, the company expects net sales to be JPY 915,000 million, operating income to be JPY 16,700 million, profit attributable to owners of parent to be JPY 10,900 million and profit JPY 11.83 per share against net sales to be JPY 930,000 million, operating income to be JPY 21,000 million, profit attributable to owners of parent to be JPY 15,000 million and profit 16.04 per share. Reasons for Revision: For the second quarter of the year ending March 2026, while domestic business generally performed in line with financial forecasts, overseas business saw a decrease in profits due to a decline in market conditions for pulp and other products.

As a result, operating profit is expected to fall below the previous financial forecast. Furthermore, ordinary profit and profit attributable to owners of parent are also expected to fall below the previous financial forecast due to the decline in operating profit and other factors. The full-year consolidated financial forecast for the year ending March 2026 is currently under review.

It is scheduled to be announced simultaneously with the financial results for the second quarter of the year ending March 2026, which are scheduled for release on November 7, 2025.

Astellas Pharma Inc. Revises Consolidated Earnings Guidance for Fiscal Year 2025 Ending March 31, 2026
data.description: Astellas Pharma Inc. revised consolidated earnings guidance for fiscal year 2025 ending March 31, 2026. For the year, the company now expects revenue of JPY 2,030,000 million against previous guidance of JPY 1,930,000 million, Operating profit of JPY 240,000 million against previous guidance of JPY 160,000 million, Profit for the year of JPY 180,000 million against previous guidance of JPY 130,000 million, and Basic earnings per share of JPY 100.50 per share against previous guidance of JPY 72.61.

China Resources Microelectronics Limited Reports Earnings Results for the Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
China Resources Microelectronics Limited reported earnings results for the nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the nine months, the company reported sales was CNY 8,068.87 million compared to CNY 7,471.67 million a year ago. Revenue was CNY 8,068.87 million compared to CNY 7,471.67 million a year ago.

Net income was CNY 525.5 million compared to CNY 499.31 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was CNY 0.3963 compared to CNY 0.3776 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was CNY 0.3962 compared to CNY 0.3776 a year ago.

Comcast Tops Forecasts With Fewer Customer Defections Than Expected
data.description:
By Dean Seal


Comcast lost fewer broadband and video customers in the third quarter than Wall Street had expected, buoying its top and bottom lines while its wireless business gained steam.

The cable-and-entertainment company said Thursday that it added 414,000 customer lines for its Xfinity Mobile wireless business. That is better than the 393,000 additions analysts had been looking for, according to FactSet. Xfinity Mobile's revenue rose 14% year-over-year, to $1.25 billion.

The company meanwhile lost 257,000 domestic video customers as viewers continue to cut the cord on cable TV. Analysts surveyed by FactSet had forecast that it would shed 310,000 video customers. Revenue for the cable business was down 5%, at $6.59 billion.

Comcast also lost 104,000 broadband customers in the U.S., once again bucking the expectations of analysts who had been expecting 143,000 broadband customers to exit. Domestic broadband revenue was up slightly, at $6.43 billion.

In total, the company lost 210,000 customer relationships, or 1.4% from a year earlier, while the average total revenue it brings in per customer relationship was up slightly.

Peacock, the streaming app of Comcast's NBCUniversal, saw revenue decline about 10%, to $1.36 billion, from the same quarter last year, which included the Olympics. Peacock's tally of paid subscribers was up 14% from year-ago, at 41 million, and roughly flat compared with the June quarter.

Revenue from the company's Universal Studios theme parks was up 18.7%, at $2.72 billion, while revenue from its studios was up 6.1%, at $3 billion.

In total, revenue ticked down 2.7%, to $31.2 billion, ahead of analyst projections for a steeper drop to $30.7 billion, according to FactSet.

Comcast posted a quarterly profit of $3.33 billion, or 90 cents a share, compared with $3.63 billion, or 94 cents a share, in the same quarter a year earlier.

Stripping out one-time items, adjusted earnings were $1.12 a share, two cents ahead of the consensus estimate of analysts polled by FactSet.


Write to Dean Seal at dean.seal@wsj.com


(END) Dow Jones Newswires

10-30-25 0715ET

Abu Dhabi's Lunate to commit $1 billion to new investment platform launched with BlackRock's HPS
data.description:
ABU DHABI (Reuters) -BlackRock-owned HPS Investment Partners and Abu Dhabi's Lunate plan to launch a new platform to invest in large North American and European corporates, to which Lunate will commit at least $1 billion, the companies said on Thursday.

The focus of the HPS Strategic Solutions Partners Platform will be on privately negotiated preferred and common stock investments, and related debt instruments in large companies, mainly in the United States and Europe, their statement said.

As they look to capitalise on the growing demand for private capital, HPS and Lunate will also work together to allow investors based in the Middle East to access the new platform.

"Market dynamics continue to create attractive opportunities for customised, scaled capital solutions, as both sponsor and non-sponsor owned large companies seek flexible sources of financing," said Scot French, founding partner and co-president of HPS.

HPS which had $165 billion in assets under management at the end of June.

Abu Dhabi, the capital of the United Arab Emirates, is home to three wealth funds that collectively manage about $1.5 trillion in assets.

It is creating a new national champion in the alternative investments sector with Lunate, which manages $110 billion in assets and has a core focus on private markets.

Lunate and Blackstone unveiled a plan this month to set up a platform targeting investments in logistics assets in the Gulf region worth $5 billion.

(Reporting by Rachna Uppal; Editing by Clarence Fernandez)

Fermi America in Partnership with the Texas Tech University System, Enters Long-Term Capital Lease Agreement with Mobile Power Solutions
data.description:
Fermi America in partnership with the Texas Tech University System, has entered a long-term capital lease agreement with Mobile Power Solutions (MPS) for seven GE TM2500 gas turbines, totaling 157.5 megawatts (MW) of nameplate capacity. These fast-deploying, high-efficiency, versatile turbines expand Fermi's natural gas platform - a cornerstone of Project Matador, the world's largest 11GW private HyperGrid?? campus.

The TM2500 units will bring flexible, dispatchable power online as Fermi delivers on its mission to secure American energy and AI dominance by integrating natural gas, nuclear, solar, and battery storage at scale. The turbines will be delivered in the fourth quarter of 2025, entering commercial operation in early 2026 as part of Fermi's first 500 MW of generation capacity. A critical part of Fermi's initial tranche of power, the TM2500's will remain long-term as part of the strategic assets supporting Fermi's aggressive growth goals to keep pace with the country's AI demand.

As part of the agreement, Fermi and MPS intend to collaborate on future acquisitions of additional TM2500 units.
